threadsafe.span: ，只要不修改该集合可以同时支持多个读取器。

span.span: An can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 若要保证的线程安全，必须通过返回的包装器完成所有操作方法。

span.span: To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through the wrapper returned by the method.

threadsafe.span: 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。

span.span: Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不会复制的内容。 does not copy the contents of . 相反，而只会创建周围的包装器; 因此，将更改为也会影响。Instead, it only creates an wrapper around ; therefore, changes to the also affect the . 类提供了泛型，和方法。The class provides generic , and methods. 此包装器可以是一种方法来使用这些方法; 但是，执行通过包装这些泛型操作可能会比直接应用于操作的效率较低。This wrapper can be a means to use those methods on ; however, performing these generic operations through the wrapper might be less efficient than operations applied directly on the . 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## 版本兼容性Version Compatibility 在.NET Framework 版本 1.0 和 1.1 中，调用方法重载上的包装返回的枚举数上限为而不是计数处理第二个参数。In the .NET Framework version 1.0 and 1.1, calling the method overload on the wrapper returned an enumerator that treated the second argument as an upper bound rather than as a count. 在[!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)]作为计数正确处理第二个参数。In the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] the second argument is correctly treated as a count.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 接受`null`为有效的值，并允许重复元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value and allows duplicate elements. 中的元素的顺序保留在。The order of the elements in the is preserved in the . 如果新(当前plus 集合的大小) 将大于，则容量的增加通过自动重新分配要容纳新元素的内部数组和之前添加新元素，现有元素将复制到新数组。If the new (the current plus the size of the collection) will be greater than , the capacity of the is increased by automatically reallocating the internal array to accommodate the new elements, and the existing elements are copied to the new array before the new elements are added. 如果可以容纳新元素而不增加，此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是要添加的元素数。If the can accommodate the new elements without increasing the , this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements to be added. 如果需要增加以容纳新元素的容量，此方法将成为 O (`n` + `m`) 操作，其中`n`是要添加的元素数并`m`是。If the capacity needs to be increased to accommodate the new elements, this method becomes an O(`n` + `m`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements to be added and `m` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将元素添加到。The following code example shows how to add elements to the . remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`参数和每个元素必须实现接口，用于比较。The `value` parameter and each element of the must implement the interface, which is used for comparisons. 元素必须已在提高根据定义的排序顺序的值进行排序实现; 否则，结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by the implementation; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 比较`null`允许使用任何类型和使用时不会生成异常。Comparing `null` with any type is allowed and does not generate an exception when using . 排序时，`null`被视为小于任何其他对象。When sorting, `null` is considered to be less than any other object. 如果多个元素具有相同的值，该方法将返回只包含其中一个匹配项，并且它可能会返回任何一个匹配项，不一定是第一个。If the contains more than one element with the same value, the method returns only one of the occurrences, and it might return any one of the occurrences, not necessarily the first one. 如果不包含指定的值，该方法返回一个负整数。If the does not contain the specified value, the method returns a negative integer. 您可以应用于此负整数，以获取大于搜索值的第一个元素的索引的按位求补运算 （~）。You can apply the bitwise complement operation (~) to this negative integer to get the index of the first element that is larger than the search value. 当将值插入到，此索引应使用作为插入点，以保持排序顺序。When inserting the value into the , this index should be used as the insertion point to maintain the sort order. 此方法为 O (log `n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用来查找中的特定对象。The following code example shows how to use to locate a specific object in the . 否则，结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by the implementation; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 比较`null`允许使用任何类型和使用时不会生成异常。Comparing `null` with any type is allowed and does not generate an exception when using . 排序时，`null`被视为小于任何其他对象。When sorting, `null` is considered to be less than any other object. 如果多个元素具有相同的值，该方法将返回只包含其中一个匹配项，并且它可能会返回任何一个匹配项，不一定是第一个。If the contains more than one element with the same value, the method returns only one of the occurrences, and it might return any one of the occurrences, not necessarily the first one. 如果不包含指定的值，该方法返回一个负整数。If the does not contain the specified value, the method returns a negative integer. 您可以应用于此负整数，以获取大于搜索值的第一个元素的索引的按位求补运算 （~）。You can apply the bitwise complement operation (~) to this negative integer to get the index of the first element that is larger than the search value. 当将值插入到，此索引应使用作为插入点，以保持排序顺序。When inserting the value into the , this index should be used as the insertion point to maintain the sort order. 此方法为 O (log `n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的示例创建彩色动画。The following example creates an of colored animals. 提供执行二进制搜索的字符串比较。The provided performs the string comparison for the binary search. 显示迭代搜索和二进制搜索的结果。The results of both an iterative search and a binary search are displayed. remarks.format: ## Remarks 比较器自定义对元素进行比较。The comparer customizes how the elements are compared. 例如，可以使用作为要执行不区分大小写的字符串搜索的比较器的实例。For example, you can use a instance as the comparer to perform case-insensitive string searches. 如果`comparer`提供的元素为指定的值使用指定比较实现。If `comparer` is provided, the elements of the are compared to the specified value using the specified implementation. 元素必须已在提高根据定义的排序顺序的值进行排序`comparer`; 否则为结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by `comparer`; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 如果`comparer`是`null`，完成比较使用元素本身或指定的值提供的实现。If `comparer` is `null`, the comparison is done using the implementation provided by the element itself or by the specified value. 元素必须已在提高根据定义的排序顺序的值进行排序实现; 否则，结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by the implementation; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 比较`null`允许使用任何类型和使用时不会生成异常。Comparing `null` with any type is allowed and does not generate an exception when using . 排序时，`null`被视为小于任何其他对象。When sorting, `null` is considered to be less than any other object. 如果多个元素具有相同的值，该方法将返回只包含其中一个匹配项，并且它可能会返回任何一个匹配项，不一定是第一个。If the contains more than one element with the same value, the method returns only one of the occurrences, and it might return any one of the occurrences, not necessarily the first one. 如果不包含指定的值，该方法返回一个负整数。If the does not contain the specified value, the method returns a negative integer. 您可以应用于此负整数，以获取大于搜索值的第一个元素的索引的按位求补运算 （~）。You can apply the bitwise complement operation (~) to this negative integer to get the index of the first element that is larger than the search value. 当将值插入到，此索引应使用作为插入点，以保持排序顺序。When inserting the value into the , this index should be used as the insertion point to maintain the sort order. 此方法为 O (log `n`) 操作，其中`n`是`count`。This method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is `count`.

span.span: An for the entire .

remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的示例获取的枚举数，和一系列中的元素的枚举器。The following example gets the enumerator for an , and the enumerator for a range of elements in the . [!code-csharp[Collections.ArrayList.GetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/collections.arraylist.getenumerator/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Collections.ArrayList.GetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/collections.arraylist.getenumerator/vb/program.vb#1)]

therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## 版本兼容性Version Compatibility 有关.NET Framework 版本 1.0 和 1.1 中，枚举器中返回的包装器方法处理第二个参数为上限而不是计数。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, the enumerator for an wrapper returned by the method treated the second argument as an upper bound rather than as a count. 在[!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)]作为计数正确处理第二个参数。In the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] the second argument is correctly treated as a count. ## Examples 下面的示例获取的枚举数，和一系列中的元素的枚举器。The following example gets the enumerator for an , and the enumerator for a range of elements in the . remarks.format: ## Remarks 接受`null`为有效的值，并允许重复元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value and allows duplicate elements. 如果已等于，则容量的自动重新分配内部数组中，增加和现有元素之前添加新元素将复制到新数组。If already equals , the capacity of the is increased by automatically reallocating the internal array, and the existing elements are copied to the new array before the new element is added. 如果`index`等同于，`value`添加到末尾。If `index` is equal to , `value` is added to the end of . 在由连续的元素组成的集合（如列表）中，插入点下面的元素将下移以容纳新的元素。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element. 如果集合具有索引，则移动的元素的索引也将更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 此行为不适用于元素按概念划分为不同存储桶的集合，如哈希表。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将元素插入。The following code example shows how to insert elements into the . remarks.format: ## Remarks 接受`null`为有效的值，并允许重复元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value and allows duplicate elements. 如果新(当前plus 集合的大小) 将大于，则容量的增加通过自动重新分配要容纳新元素的内部数组和之前添加新元素，现有元素将复制到新数组。If the new (the current plus the size of the collection) will be greater than , the capacity of the is increased by automatically reallocating the internal array to accommodate the new elements, and the existing elements are copied to the new array before the new elements are added. 如果`index`等同于，元素将被添加到末尾。If `index` is equal to , the elements are added to the end of . 中的元素的顺序保留在。The order of the elements in the is preserved in the . 在由连续的元素组成的集合（如列表）中，插入点下面的元素将下移以容纳新的元素。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element. 如果集合具有索引，则移动的元素的索引也将更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 此行为不适用于元素按概念划分为不同存储桶的集合，如哈希表。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table. 此方法为 O (`n` + `m`) 操作，其中`n`是要添加的元素数并`m`是。This method is an O(`n` + `m`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements to be added and `m` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将元素插入。The following code example shows how to insert elements into the . remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合只是一个集合与防止添加和移除元素; 的包装器因此，如果在更改基础集合，包括添加或删除的元素，大小固定集合反映了这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何创建固定大小周围的包装器。The following code example shows how to create a fixed-size wrapper around an . remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要保证的线程安全，必须通过返回的包装器完成所有操作方法。To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through the wrapper returned by the method. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the during the entire enumeration. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使用，它使用快速排序算法。This method uses , which uses the QuickSort algorithm. 快速排序算法进行了比较排序 （也称为不稳定排序），这意味着，一个"小于或等于"比较操作将确定这两个元素应首先出现在最后一个已排序的列表。The QuickSort algorithm is a comparison sort (also called an unstable sort), which means that a "less than or equal to" comparison operation determines which of two elements should occur first in the final sorted list. 但是，如果两个元素相等，则可能不会保留其原始顺序。However, if two elements are equal, their original order might not be preserved. 与此相反，一个稳定排序保留相等元素的顺序。In contrast, a stable sort preserves the order of elements that are equal. 若要执行一个稳定排序，必须实现一个自定义接口，以便使用与此方法的其他重载。To perform a stable sort, you must implement a custom interface to use with the other overloads of this method. 一般情况下，此方法为 O (`n`日志`n`) 操作，其中`n`是; 在最坏的情况是 O (`n`^2) 操作。On average, this method is an O(`n` log `n`) operation, where `n` is ; in the worst case it is an O(`n`^2) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何对中的值进行排序。The following code example shows how to sort the values in an . remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 方法通过实现 接口的自定义比较器对对象的列表进行排序。Use the method to sort a list of objects with a custom comparer that implements the interface. 如果为 `null` 传递 `comparer`，则此方法将使用每个元素的 实现。If you pass `null` for `comparer`, this method uses the implementation of each element. 在此情况下，您必须确保列表中包含的对象实现 接口，否则将发生异常。In this case, you must make sure that the objects contained in the list implement the interface or an exception will occur. 此外，使用 实现意味着此列表将执行比较排序（也称为“不稳定排序”）；也就是说，如果两个元素相等，则可能不会保留其顺序。In addition, using the implementation means the list performs a comparison sort (also called an unstable sort); that is, if two elements are equal, their order might not be preserved. 与此相反，一个稳定排序保留相等元素的顺序。In contrast, a stable sort preserves the order of elements that are equal. 若要执行一个稳定排序，必须实现一个自定义接口。To perform a stable sort, you must implement a custom interface. 一般情况下，此方法为 O (`n`日志`n`) 操作，其中`n`是; 在最坏的情况是 O (`n`^2) 操作。On average, this method is an O(`n` log `n`) operation, where `n` is ; in the worst case it is an O(`n`^2) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何对中的值进行排序使用默认比较器和将反转排序顺序的自定义比较器。The following code example shows how to sort the values in an using the default comparer and a custom comparer that reverses the sort order. remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要保证的线程安全，必须通过此包装器完成所有操作。To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through this wrapper. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/CPP/source2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/CS/source2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/VB/source2.vb#2)] 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. 下面的代码示例显示了如何同步，确定是否同步以及如何使用同步。The following code example shows how to synchronize an , determine if an is synchronized and use a synchronized . remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要创建的同步的版本，使用方法。To create a synchronized version of the , use the method. 但是，派生的类可以提供其自己的同步的版本使用属性。However, derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the using the property. 同步代码必须在执行操作的，而不是直接在。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the of the , not directly on the . 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体而言，它维护与其他线程可能同时对修改的正确同步对象。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the object. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the during the entire enumeration.
